title: How to Make Chocolate Sorbet

steps.headline: Mix the sugar and cocoa powder.
steps.description: Tip the sugar into a bowl, sift in the cocoa powder, and stir.

steps.headline: Boil the water.
steps.description: Bring the 600ml water to a boil in a medium saucepan.

steps.headline: Add the sugar and cocoa.
steps.description: Whisk in the sugar and cocoa powder, and return to a gentle simmer.

steps.headline: Simmer the chocolate mixture.
steps.description: Simmer, uncovered, for 5 minutes, whisking occasionally.

text: Mix the sugar and cocoa powder. Tip the sugar into a bowl, sift in the cocoa powder, and stir. Boil the water. Bring the 600ml water to a boil in a medium saucepan. Add the sugar and cocoa. Whisk in the sugar and cocoa powder, and return to a gentle simmer. Simmer the chocolate mixture. Simmer, uncovered, for 5 minutes, whisking occasionally. Add the chocolate and vanilla. Remove from the heat and stir in the chocolate and vanilla extract until the chocolate has melted. Have the mixture cool. Cool the mixture for about 10 minutes. Have the sorbet chill. Place the sorbet in the fridge for several hours till overnight, until well chilled. Add the sorbet in an ice cream machine. Make the sorbet in an ice-cream machine or pour into a rigid plastic container, preferably bowl shaped. Freeze until frozen 3 centimeter (1.2 in) from the edges. Freeze again. Whisk to break down the ice crystals. Then freeze again for 1 hour more. Whisk and freeze again one more time. Leave until completely frozen. Have sorbet soften and serve. Before serving, transfer to the fridge for 30 mins to make scooping easier. Serve. Enjoy!
